titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Trumbull College Manuscript Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:08
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Trumbull College manuscript collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Contains legal documents signed by Jonathan Trumbull (1710-1785) while governor, and one letter from him to Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809); a letter from George Washington to Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809); letters between John Trumbull and various people, regarding his paintings and exhibitions; receipts relating to his work; and draft and printed versions of the handbill announcing the print of his "The Declaration of Independence."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Deposited at the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library in 1972 by Trumbull College, Yale University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Trumbull College Manuscript Collection is the physical property of Trumbull College, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Trumbull College Manuscript Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses material that was deposited at the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library in 1972 by Trumbull College; this material pertains to Jonathan Trumbull (1710-1785), Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809), and John Trumbull.

did.unittitle: Jonathan Trumbull (1710-1785)
LEGAL DOCUMENTS
Requirement, Lebanon, [Conn.], to Sheriff of Windham County to attach the goods or estate of Joseph Barne in response to payments owed to [Taber?] Huntington of Norwich

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed form, with manuscript insertions. Signed by Trumbull.

did.unittitle: Requirement, Lebanon, [Conn.], to Sheriff of Windham County to summon Elisha Blackman to appear before Isaac Huntington in Norwich regarding one pound owed to Nathanael Lothrop

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed form, with manuscript insertions. Signed by Trumbull. Endorsed on verso by Simon Tubb of Colchester.

did.unittitle: Requirement, Hartford, [Conn.], to Sheriff of Windham County to attach the goods or estate of William Dewey in response to payments owed to Joshua Huntington of Norwich

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed form, with manuscript insertions. Signed by Trumbull.

did.unittitle: Requirement, Lebanon, [Conn.], to Sheriff of Hartford County to summon James Fitch to appear before Isaac Huntington in Norwich regarding claim by Isaac Williams of trespass

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript. Signed by Trumbull.

did.unittitle: Acceptance, Hartford, [Conn.], to Isaac Goodwin as Ensign of the 9th Company or Trainband in the 17th Regiment in Connecticut

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed form, with manuscript insertions. Signed by Secretary and by Trumbull as governor.

did.unittitle: LETTERS FROM JONATHAN TRUMBULL
ALS, Lebanon, to Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809)
Jonathan Trumbull (1740-1809)
LETTERS TO JONATHAN TRUMBULL
Trumbull, Jonathan (1710-1785). ALS, Lebanon
Washington, George. ALS, Mount Vernon
John Trumbull (1756-1843)
LETTERS FROM JOHN TRUMBULL
ALS, New York, to Mr. Elgar, Washington
ALS, Washington, to Joseph Hopkinson, Philadelphia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. Chapman. Signed with initials. On same page is AL (draft) to Thomas Sully, Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: AL, New York, to Mr. Stelle, Washington

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding paintings in the Rotunda. On verso is ALS (draft) to Mr. Elgar regarding same matter. Written on verso of printed form announcing a meeting of the New-York Literary and Philosophical Society for 1830 Oct 7.

did.unittitle: AL, Washington, to Thomas Sully, Philadelphia
ALS, London, to W. Willard, Pres. Har[vard] Col[lege]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding prints that JT donated to Harvard. Signed with initials.

did.unittitle: LETTERS TO JOHN TRUMBULL
ALS from Boston Athenaeum, Boston, [Mass.] to Academy of Arts, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding upcoming exhibition of 1829 May 4-Jul 11. Signed by the exhibition committee.

did.unittitle: ALS from Theodore Dwight, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding exhibition. Notes, holograph, by JT on p. 2-3 regarding expenses.

did.unittitle: ALS from J. Elgar, Capitol, U. S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding expenses. Note, holograph, by JT on verso.

did.unittitle: ALS from D[avid] Lenox, Philadelphia to New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding JT's prints, which Lenox is shipping via Captain John Segar's vessel, "Melinda." On first page is receipt from Segar to Lenox.
